intro: Eriocaulon hamiltonianum var. acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed rice sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, producing tiny white or pale blue flowers. This variety is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing wetland habitats and supporting various insect and bird species.
